query: /host-panel "Should foundation model weights be open-sourced?" oxford
expected_behavior: Agent parses arguments: topic is the quoted string, format is 'oxford', expert count defaults to 4
Agent identifies this as a binary proposition suitable for Oxford-style debate
Agent performs Research Grounding with WebSearch for current literature on open vs closed model weights
Agent generates 4 personas with formal proposition and opposition sides, including at least one contrarian
Agent loads references/formats.md for Oxford-specific phase structure (opening arguments, cross-examination, rebuttals)
Agent runs Devil's Advocate Rotation during the Direct Rebuttal phase
Agent asks at least 2 panelists about the strongest case against their own position (Uncomfortable Implications)
Synthesis identifies the underlying axiom of disagreement between open and closed positions
